page.title: 05 Ecology
page.content: Since our area is mainly farmland the ultimate is to achieve highly productive crops.Therefore a great deal of fertiliser and weed killer is used with the result that wild life has suffered.Recently people have become more conscious of the country side deprivation. In our area we found half an acre of unspoilt meadowland.As we studied this closely we found cowslips,yarrow, buttercups,clover,dandelion and plantain.The hedge consisted of different trees the most interesting of which was the elm indicating its return after the ravages of Dutch Elm disease.In the hedge row were red and white dead nettles and foxgloves.At the bottom of the field where the R.Dene flows a spinney has been planted by the D family and their constribution to conservation.
